awd_titl_txt: SBIR Phase II:  Implementation of a Digital Health Platform to Enable Behavioral Health Integration in Multiple Care Settings
awd_abstract_narration:
The broader/commercial impact of this SBIR Phase II project aims to enable behavioral health access and engagement across the continuum of care by improving outcomes, overall wellness, and cost of care by combining integrated care, evidence-based tools, and data science. Approximately 1 in 5 adults in the U.S. experience mental illness in a given year, which costs an estimated $752 billion in healthcare expenditures annually. The proposed work will use artificial intelligence and data science capabilities to create personalized patient experiences outside of clinical settings to improve health outcomes, care team efficiency, and resource utilization. 

This SBIR Phase II project will use artificial intelligence and data science capabilities to create personalized patient experiences outside of clinical settings. This project will: 1) advance a system with EHR interoperability managing a bi-directional flow of discrete data; 2) automate components of the platform’s comprehensive content and assignment library; and 3) use artificial intelligence, specifically real-time natural language processing, to identify and support patients that are potentially in crisis.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Technology, Innovation, and Partnerships

por.por_cntn:
NeuroFlow successfully developed a comprehensive behavioral health platform that integrates into various healthcare settings, addressing critical gaps in mental healthcare delivery. During this NSF SBIR Phase II and IIB award period, NeuroFlow transformed from a promising startup to an established healthcare technology company with substantial commercial success. The project focused on three key technical objectives: achieving interoperability with electronic health record (EHR) systems, obtaining industry-standard security certifications, and enhancing patient care through artificial intelligence and data science capabilities. NeuroFlow successfully implemented EHR integrations with major systems including Epic and athenahealth, achieved HITRUST and SOC 2 Type 2 certifications, and developed sophisticated risk stratification algorithms that help healthcare providers identify and support patients with behavioral health needs.

The technological innovations developed through this NSF funding have significantly advanced the integration of behavioral health into physical healthcare settings. NeuroFlow created a proprietary severity score algorithm that predicts behavioral health risk levels, validated through peer-reviewed research. The platform achieved bi-directional integrations with major EHR systems, enabling seamless workflow integration for healthcare providers and reducing barriers to behavioral health integration. The system uses sophisticated natural language processing to analyze patient journal entries for potential risk indicators, helping to identify patients experiencing suicidal ideation even when not directly reported through assessments. NeuroFlow also developed configurable branding functionality that allows healthcare organizations to maintain consistent branding while leveraging NeuroFlow's technology, a feature that has proven critical for enterprise adoption.

NeuroFlow's platform has contributed significantly to addressing the national behavioral health crisis by enabling behavioral health screening and support in primary care and other settings, helping identify and support millions of patients who might otherwise have gone without behavioral health care. The platform has been adopted nationwide by hospital systems, payors and multiple branches of the US military. Implementation of NeuroFlow's technology has demonstrated measurable healthcare cost reductions by enabling earlier intervention and appropriate care routing. The company's growth created jobs across multiple disciplines, particularly in technology, healthcare, and data science fields. Through strategic acquisitions of organizations offering complementary products, NeuroFlow has solidified its position as the market leader in behavioral health measurement and engagement technologies, extending its capabilities across the continuum of care settings. The project has successfully bridged the gap between behavioral and physical health, creating a scalable model for identifying and addressing behavioral health needs across healthcare settings.


Last Modified: 03/06/2025
Modified by: Adam M Pardes
